messages.text:
It's small data, but it's still surprising to me how fast this is:
```julia> m
@model X begin
        β ~ Normal() |> iid(size(X, 2))
        y ~ For(eachrow(X)) do x
                Normal(x' * β, 1)
            end
        return y
    end


julia> size(X)
(20, 2)

julia> @btime dynamicHMC($(m(X=X) | (;y)));
  61.764 ms (1170412 allocations: 49.26 MiB)```
This takes 1000 samples. There's no symbolic stuff here, the big gain in speed is just from MeasureTheory. And we still have way too many allocations, so I think this will get better still.
